<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 10"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Unstable Concoction](/Feats.aspx?ID=5790) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Additive" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=795" />
<trait label="Alchemist" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=812" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 67 <sup>1.1</sup>

</column>

---

You can mix a wondrous yet volatile liquid into an [alchemical](/Traits.aspx?ID=528) [consumable](/Traits.aspx?ID=564) if it has an initial effect that uses dice. You [increase the size of any dice](/Rules.aspx?ID=2305) for the item's initial effect by one step. For instance, you could increase damage from a [moderate alchemist's fire](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3287) to 2d10 or healing from a [moderate elixir of life](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3308) to 5d8+12. Because this affects only initial dice, it wouldn't increase unarmed attack damage from a [bestial mutagen](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3315), [persistent damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) from an [acid flask](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3286), and the like. When this item is activated, the creature activating it must succeed at a DC 10 [flat check](/Rules.aspx?ID=333) or take acid damage equal to the item's level.
name: Unstable Concoction
